verses.verse: Oh <S%H3863>that<s%> thou wouldest <S%H7167>rend<s%> the <S%H8064>heavens,<s%> that thou wouldest come <S%H3381>down,<s%> that the <S%H2022>mountains<s%> might flow <S%H2151>down<s%> at thy <S%H4480>presence,<s%> <S%H6440><s%>

As when the <S%H2003>melting<s%> <S%H784>fire<s%> <S%H6919>burneth,<s%> the <S%H784>fire<s%> causeth the <S%H4325>waters<s%> to <S%H1158>boil,<s%> to make thy <S%H8034>name<s%> <S%H3045>known<s%> to thine <S%H6862>adversaries,<s%> that the <S%H1471>nations<s%> may <S%H7264>tremble<s%> at thy <S%H4480>presence!<s%> <S%H6440><s%>

When thou <S%H6213>didst<s%> terrible <S%H3372>things<s%> which we looked not <S%H6960>for,<s%> <S%H3808><s%> thou camest <S%H3381>down,<s%> the <S%H2022>mountains<s%> flowed <S%H2151>down<s%> at thy <S%H4480>presence.<s%> <S%H6440><s%>

For since the beginning of the <S%H4480>world<s%> <S%H5769><s%> men have <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H8085>heard,<s%> <S%H3808>nor<s%> perceived by the <S%H238>ear,<s%> <S%H3808>neither<s%> hath the <S%H5869>eye<s%> <S%H7200>seen,<s%> O <S%H430>God,<s%> <S%H2108>beside<s%> thee, what he hath <S%H6213>prepared<s%> for him that <S%H2442>waiteth<s%> for him.

Thou <S%H6293>meetest<s%> <S%H853><s%> him that <S%H7797>rejoiceth<s%> and <S%H6213>worketh<s%> <S%H6664>righteousness,<s%> those that <S%H2142>remember<s%> thee in thy <S%H1870>ways:<s%> <S%H2005>behold,<s%> <S%H859>thou<s%> art <S%H7107>wroth;<s%> for we have <S%H2398>sinned:<s%> in those is <S%H5769>continuance,<s%> and we shall be <S%H3467>saved.<s%>

But we <S%H1961>are<s%> <S%H3605>all<s%> as an <S%H2931>unclean<s%> thing, and <S%H3605>all<s%> our <S%H6666>righteousnesses<s%> are as <S%H5708>filthy<s%> <S%H899>rags;<s%> and we <S%H3605>all<s%> do <S%H5034>fade<s%> as a <S%H5929>leaf;<s%> and our <S%H5771>iniquities,<s%> like the <S%H7307>wind,<s%> have taken us <S%H5375>away.<s%>

And there is <S%H369>none<s%> that <S%H7121>calleth<s%> upon thy <S%H8034>name,<s%> that stirreth up <S%H5782>himself<s%> to take <S%H2388>hold<s%> of thee: <S%H3588>for<s%> thou hast <S%H5641>hid<s%> thy <S%H6440>face<s%> <S%H4480>from<s%> us, and hast <S%H4127>consumed<s%> us, <S%H3027>because<s%> of our <S%H5771>iniquities.<s%>

But <S%H6258>now,<s%> O <S%H3068>LORD,<s%> <S%H859>thou<s%> art our <S%H1>father;<s%> <S%H587>we<s%> are the <S%H2563>clay,<s%> and <S%H859>thou<s%> our <S%H3335>potter;<s%> and we <S%H3605>all<s%> are the <S%H4639>work<s%> of thy <S%H3027>hand.<s%>

Be not <S%H7107>wroth<s%> <S%H408><s%> very <S%H5704>sore,<s%> <S%H3966><s%> O <S%H3068>LORD,<s%> <S%H408>neither<s%> <S%H2142>remember<s%> <S%H5771>iniquity<s%> <S%H5703>forever:<s%> <S%H2005>behold,<s%> <S%H5027>see,<s%> we beseech <S%H4994>thee,<s%> we are <S%H3605>all<s%> thy <S%H5971>people.<s%>

Our <S%H6944>holy<s%> and our <S%H8597>beautiful<s%> <S%H1004>house,<s%> <S%H834>where<s%> our <S%H1>fathers<s%> <S%H1984>praised<s%> thee, <S%H1961>is<s%> burned <S%H8316>up<s%> with <S%H784>fire:<s%> and <S%H3605>all<s%> our pleasant <S%H4261>things<s%> <S%H1961>are<s%> laid <S%H2723>waste.<s%>

Wilt thou refrain <S%H662>thyself<s%> <S%H5921>for<s%> <S%H428>these<s%> things, O <S%H3068>LORD?<s%> wilt thou hold thy <S%H2814>peace,<s%> and <S%H6031>afflict<s%> us very <S%H5704>sore?<s%> <S%H3966><s%>
